data.title: David Assaraf
data.text:
David Assaraf is a singer, songwriter and composer, but also an actor and stage director.

At the theater, he played under the direction of Didier Bezace in “La Version de Browning” (5 nominations-2 Molières).

At the cinema under that of Gabriel LeBomin in “The Fragments of Antonin” (film named Cesar).

On television for Lucas Belvaux or Jean-Daniel Veraeghe. He also directed “L’Echange” by Paul Claudel at the Théâtre du Soleil.

As for music, he wrote, composed or collaborated with Sylvie Vartan, Arthur H, Keren Ann, Carmen Maria Vega, Matthieu Chedid and many more.

« Juré craché sur vos tombes » is his first single, released in 2018. The clip was directed by Gaëtan Chataignier (Philippe Katerine, Bernard Lavilliers, Dominique A ..). A road trip, a man in the middle of the desert, with only companions a rope … and a knife.

Recently, he wrote with Matthieu Chedid his last album, Lettre Infinie, and open M’ concerts in France.
